_header: A knight was while a rich man that honoured much mid all
_description: A miracle of Our Lady, the Virgin Mary comes to Devil instead of Victim, in the South English Legendary — in couplets

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
A Knight was while a riche man þat honoured mich wiþ
                    alleOure lady & alle hire festes þat in þe ȝer doþ
                    falle…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Of oure lady al day we seoþ ffaire miracles &
                    greteÞei we haue of somme y told ȝet wile we not lete
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

OxfTri57.First Lines:
A knyȝt was whyle a riche man þat honourede moche with
                    alleOure Leuedy and alle here festen þat in þe ȝer doþ
                    falle…
OxfTri57.Last Lines:
…Of oure Leuedy faire meracles al day we seþ and
                    greteþeȝ we haue of synne y told ȝut nelle we noȝt
                    lete

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
A Knyght was while a rich man þat moste honourde of alOur lady
                    & hir days al os þai in þe ȝere gon falGret festis he
                    made hade his power ilk a lady dayIn honour of our swet lady hir to plese
                    & pay…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…And when þai died to heuene þai went þurgh our
                    lordeȝ graceNow goddeȝ modre pray for vs & brynge vs to
                    þat place

CamCCC145.First Lines:
A kniȝt was wile a richeman þat honurede muche mid
                    alleOure leuedi & al hure festes þat in þe ȝer doþ
                    falle…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Of oure leuedy faire miracles we seoþ aldai &
                    greteÞei we habbe of somme itold ȝute nolle we noȝt
                    lete
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 231.

CamTCC605.First Lines:
A knyȝt was wyle a ryche man þat honoured muche myd
                    alleoure leuedy & hure festes þat in þe ȝere doþ
                    falle…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…& seruys oure leuedy wel þat to hem was myld &
                    hende& worle goud hii hadde ynow to here lyues ende
CamTCC605.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.25.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.25.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
A kniȝt was while a riche man þat honourede muche wiþ
                    alleOure lady and alle hure ffestes þat in þe ȝer doþ
                    ffalle…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Of oure lady ffayre miracles al day we seoþ and
                    greteÞey we habbe of some ytold ȝut nelle we nouȝt
                    lete

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
A kniȝt was wile ariche man þat honurede Muche wiþ
                    alleOure lady & al hure festes þat in þe ȝere doþ
                    falle
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…Of oure lady feyre miracles we seþ al day &
                    greteÞey we have of somme y tolde ȝut nolle we noȝt
                    lete

BLCottCleoDIX.First Lines:
[A] kniȝt was while a riche man þat honoured moche mid
                    alleOure leuedi & alle hire festes þat in þe ȝer
                    doþ falle…
BLCottCleoDIX.Last Lines:
…Of oure leuedies faire miracles we seoþ al dai so
                    greteÞeiȝ we habbe of som itolde ȝut wole wel nouȝt
                    lete
BLCottCleoDIX.Note:
Folio number reflects the most recent foliation. Space left for enlarged
                    ‘A’, which was left blank.

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: A kniȝt was while aricheman þat onoureþe moche with alleour lady & cl hire festes þat in þe ȝer doþ falle…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …of our ladi fair miracle we seþ alday & greteþei we haue of some itold ȝut nolle we noȝt lete
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum Cv” added to left margin by later hand (f. 302v); “& cl” crossed through after “lady” in second line.
BLCottJulDIX.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Cotton_MS_Julius_D_IX.

BLEge2891.First Lines: A kniȝt was wile a riche man þat honurede muche wiþ alleOure leuedi and al hure festes þat in þe ȝer doþ falle…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …Wiþ þis word þou wende forþ þe kniȝt ne sei hure namoreHe vnder stod wel wo it was he gan to sike sore…
BLEge2891.Note: Ends incomplete at bottom of folio.

BLHar2277.First Lines: A kniȝt was while a riche man þat honurede moche mid alleOure leuedi & alle hire festes þat in þe ȝer doþ falle…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …Of oure leuedi faire Miracles we seoþ al day & greteÞeȝ we habbe of summe itold ȝut nole we noȝt lete
